questiontext.text:
1. A traffic engineer collected 1167 samples of vehicle speeds. It is found that the mean speed is 53.01 kmph while the standard deviation is 5.5 kmph. Assuming that the speed follow normal distribution, construct the 95% confidence interval on speed.


Answer (to 2 d.p.):
There is a 95% chance that the true value of mean speed lies between {1:NUMERICAL:=52.69:0.01#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again} and {1:NUMERICAL:=53.33:0.01#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}.

generalfeedback.text:
The 95% C.I. can be determined as

$$ \small x \pm 1.96 \frac{\sigma}{\sqrt{n}} =53.01 \pm 1.96 \frac{5.5}{\sqrt{1167}} = [52.69,53.33]$$

The result indicates that there is a 95% chance that the true value of mean speed lies within [52.69,53.33].

$$ \small x \pm 1.96 \frac{\sigma}{\sqrt{n}} =58.7 \pm 1.96 \frac{5.2}{\sqrt{1433}} = [58.43,58.97]$$

The result indicates that there is a 95% chance that the true value of mean speed lies within [58.43,58.97].

questiontext.text:
1. A traffic engineer collected 1255 samples of vehicle speeds. It is found that the mean speed is 51.19 kmph while the standard deviation is 6 kmph. Assuming that the speed follow normal distribution, construct the 95% confidence interval on speed.


Answer (to 2 d.p.):
There is a 95% chance that the true value of mean speed lies between {1:NUMERICAL:=50.86:0.01#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again} and {1:NUMERICAL:=51.52:0.01#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}.

generalfeedback.text:
The 95% C.I. can be determined as

$$ \small x \pm 1.96 \frac{\sigma}{\sqrt{n}} =51.19 \pm 1.96 \frac{6}{\sqrt{1255}} = [50.86,51.52]$$

The result indicates that there is a 95% chance that the true value of mean speed lies within [50.86,51.52].

questiontext.text:
1. A traffic engineer collected 1517 samples of vehicle speeds. It is found that the mean speed is 54.79 kmph while the standard deviation is 5.7 kmph. Assuming that the speed follow normal distribution, construct the 95% confidence interval on speed.


Answer (to 2 d.p.):
There is a 95% chance that the true value of mean speed lies between {1:NUMERICAL:=54.5:0.01#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again} and {1:NUMERICAL:=55.08:0.01#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}.

generalfeedback.text:
The 95% C.I. can be determined as

$$ \small x \pm 1.96 \frac{\sigma}{\sqrt{n}} =54.79 \pm 1.96 \frac{5.7}{\sqrt{1517}} = [54.5,55.08]$$

The result indicates that there is a 95% chance that the true value of mean speed lies within [54.5,55.08].
